codeSystems.title: Evaluation Status
codeSystems.description: The status of the result of an evaluation.

codeSystems.name: IntervalReasonCS
codeSystems.title: Interval Reason
codeSystems.description: This value set includes codes for the reason an interval is considered to be invalid.

codeSystems.title: Reasons why certain doses are Preferred or Allowed doses
codeSystems.description: Reasons why certain doses are Preferred or Allowed doses

codeSystems.name: VaccineGenderCS
codeSystems.title: Vaccine Gender
codeSystems.description: Value set for gender categories relevant to vaccination data.

codeSystems.name: ValidAgeReasonCS
codeSystems.title: Valid Age Reason
codeSystems.description: Value set for reasons why a patient's age is considered valid/invalid for a vaccine.

codeSystems.description: MVX Codes for manufacturers of vaccines

codeSystems.name: SNOMED_CT
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT (all versions)
codeSystems.description: SNOMED CT is the most comprehensive and precise clinical health terminology product in the world, owned and distributed around the world by The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).
codeSystems.ConceptMap-SnomedToCdsiObservation.html: SNOMED CT to CDSi Observation Code Map

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationSubpotentReason
codeSystems.title: Immunization Subpotent Reason
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.
